intro: Libanotis bayonnensis, commonly known as the Bayonne bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
